Award.AwardTitle: Conference Grant Proposal for 39th IEEE ICOPS. Conference to be held in Edinburgh, Scotland; July 8-12, 2012
Award.AbstractNarration:
ICOPS is an internationally renowned, well-attended conference involving topics of direct interest to the NSF, Universities, DOE, Air Force, and many others. The meeting is sponsored by the IEEE Nuclear and Plasma Sciences Society (NPSS). ICOPS has been held annually since 1974. Recent meetings were held in Chicago IL (2011), Norfolk VA (2010), San Diego CA (2009), Karlsruhe Germany (2008), Albuquerque NM (2007). This year's meeting will be held in Edinburgh Scotland UK at the early July 2012.

In 2012, the PI is projecting an attendance of approximately 700 participants. It is anticipated that 25% will be Government/Federal attendees and 75% will be non-federal attendees. The conference will include plenary, oral, and poster sessions on research in plasma science and technology and a Prize Addresses by the recipients of the the IEEE Marie Shklodowska-Curie Award and the IEEE NPSS Plasma Science and Applications Committee Award. Oral sessions will include both invited and contributed papers. Invited papers are allotted 25 minutes for presentation and 5 minutes for questions. Contributed papers are allotted 12 minutes for presentation and 3 minutes for questions. The ICOPS Minicourse is on Plasma Medicine and Health Care.

Applications of plasma technologies are expanding in many new areas for materials processing, lighting, environmental protection, and medical research and treatment. All of these technologies depend on a strong underpinning of basic research traditionally supported by our meeting. The program of the 39th ICOPS will emphasize both the traditional areas of plasma science and these new areas of growth through the plenary talks and the regular technical program.

This award provides funding to partially support student travel grants, particularly for underrepresented minorities, activities to promote women in engineering, and help in awards costs. The travel grants will be awarded to those students who will be presenting papers (oral talks and posters) as first authors.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The International Conference on Plasma Science (ICOPS), sponsored by the Nuclear and Plasma Sciences Society of the IEEE, is an annual internationally conference encompassing a broad range of plasma areas. ICOPS brings together researchers from across the plasma physics community in order to enhance understanding of plasma science and engineering. Topics covered range from basic plasma phenomena, to low temperature plasmas for industrial and medical applications, to energetic beams, high energy density plasmas, microwave radiation sources,  and high temperature magnetic and inertial fusion plasmas, of direct interest to Academia, industry and government labs, as well as NSF, DOE, DOD, NIH and many other agencies.

The 39th IEEE International Confernece On Plasma Science (ICOPS) was held  08-12 July 2012 in Edinburgh, Scotland at the Edinburgh Convention Center. The conference included plenary, oral, and poster sessions on research in plasma science and technology and Prize Addresses by the recipient of the Plasma Science and Applications Committee Award and the IEEE Marie Shklodowska-Curie Award.  Oral sessions included both invited and contributed papers. The ICOPS Minicourse is on Plasma Medicine and Health Care.

The ICOPS had 896 abstracts presented, with 611 registrants. The minicourse had 45 attendees. A total of 217 student attendees registered, much higher than historical values. All student members received subsidized registration fees, supported in part by this project. In addition, approximately 20 students received Student Travel Awards, which covered the student registration fee, supported in part by this project. Strong student participation achieved the goals of increasing student participation in internation research, including presentation of their own research, and learning from top researchers around the world. Students also had the opportunity to participate in the career center, as well as to network with top researchers and potential employers from academia, government laboratories, and industry.
